Name: Douglas College - Skills Connect for Immigrants
Description: Assists internationally trained professionals to transition to meaningful employment using their pre-landing education, experience and skills.

Name: Family Services of Greater Vancouver
Description: Offers a variety of programs for new immigrants and refugees, including ESL Conversation Circles and ESL for Grandparents.

Name: Fraser Works Co-op Employment Services Centre
Description: Provides career planning, job search and life skills workshops, one-on-one employment counselling  and training placement services. Career services are provided in multiple languages.

Name: Immigrant Services Society of BC
Description: Offers a variety of programs for new immigrants and refugees, including First Language Settlement Support, Immigrant Women's Peer Support Program, LINC (ESL, Language and Settlement), Moving Ahead, My Circle, Online Learning, Settlement Employment Support, Settlement Services, and Skills Connect.

Name: Lower Mainland Purpose Society
Description: Offers a variety of programs for new immigrants and refugees, including English Made Easy, Family Circle, Fun Learning and You (FLY), and Pitter-Patter Circle Time.

Name: Mosaic
Description: Offers a variety of programs for new immigrants and refugees, including Culture Connections, Employment Program of BC, I Belong Settlement Support for LGBTQ Newcomers, Moving Ahead, Settlement Workers in the Schools (SWIS), Settlement and Integration Program, and Workplace Connections Mentoring Program.

Name: New West English Language Centre
Description: Provides beginner to intermediate English language classes.

Name: New Westminster Family Place
Description: Offers a variety of programs for new immigrants and refugees, including Family Place Drop-In, Immigrant Grandparents on the Go, Mother Goose, Nobody's Perfect, and Sun Fun.

Name: New Westminster Public Library
Description: Provides Conversation Circles and English and French Reading Buddies.

Name: Public Health Services
Description: Provides medical care and social support for new immigrants and refugees whose medical needs may be complicated by cultural, knowledge and language barriers.

Name: Queensborough Community Centre
Description: Lower Mainland Purpose Society offers English Made Easy and SUCCESS offers Settlement Services for Immigrants.

Name: School District #40 (New Westminster)
Description: Provides Adult Foundations (ELL/ESL) Classes and Strong Start Early Learning Programs.

Name: SUCCESS (Qayqayt Neighbourhood Learning Centre)
Description: Offers a variety of programs for new immigrants and refugees, including Employment Mentoring Program, Group Information Classes and Workshops, Highway to Career Exploration in Canada, One-on-One Settlement Services and Diwali Newcomers Welcoming Event, and Newcomer Ambassador Program.

Name: Umbrella Multicultural Health Co-op
Description: Offers a variety of programs for new immigrants and refugees, including Many Faces of Diabetes, Pediatric Health Outreach Program, Umbrella Mobile Clinic, and Voces Maternas.

Name: Fraserside Community Services - Subsidy Programs
Description: Provides subsidies for the following programs for low income New Westminster residents: Parks, Culture and Recreation subsidies (for New Westminster Parks, Recreation and Culture programs), Kidsport BC grants (subsidized registration fees for sports programs for children) and Camping Bureau (subsidized registration fees for children's summer camps).
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Hours: Hours vary by program, please visit website for more details

Name: New Westminster Community Schools
Description: Community Schools are committed to bringing programs and services to district schools in seven core programming and service areas: physical activity, arts and exploration, literacy, leadership, social responsibility, resources for children, youth and families, community engagement and health and wellness.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Email: District Community School Coordinators: Robin Stewart (rstewart@sd40.bc.ca), Andrea Owen (aowen@sd40.bc.ca)

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Canada Games Pool
Description: Indoor swimming and fitness facilities, including aquatics and fitness programming. There are free swims during certain periods of the week/month, please contact New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation or view the Active Living Guide for details.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Hours: Facility is open on Monday-Thursday, 6:00 am - 9:55 pm, Friday, 6:00 am - 10:25 pm, Saturday, 8:00 am - 8:25 pm, Sunday, 8:00 am - 9:55 pm , hours for particular programs and services vary

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Centennial Community Centre
Description: Offers various fitness, sports, culture, arts and other programming.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Hours: Monday-Friday, 9:00 am - 8:30 pm, Friday, 9:00 am - 8:00 pm, Saturday, 8:00 am - 1:00 pm, Sunday, 8:30 am - 12:00 pm

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Century House
Description: Offers various programs for persons 50+ years old.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Hours: Monday-Friday, 9:00 am - 9:00 pm, Saturday, 9:00 am - 4:00 pm, Sunday, 12:00 pm - 4:00 pm (reduced hours during July & August)

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Hume Park Outdoor Pool
Description: Outdoor swimming facilities, including aquatics programming. There are free swims during certain periods of the week, please contact New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation or view the Active Living Guide for details.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Hours: Variable (weather-dependent) but usually open from late June to Labour Day from 1:15 pm - 8:00 pm

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Moody Park Arena
Description: Indoor ice skating rink that offers various ice sports related programs.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Moody Park Outdoor Pool
Description: Outdoor swimming facilities, including aquatics programming. There are free swims during certain periods of the week, please contact New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation or view the Active Living Guide for details .
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Hours: Variable (weather-dependent) but usually open from late June to Labour Day from 1:15 pm - 8:00 pm

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Museum and Archives (located at Anvil Centre)
Description: Offers various cultural programs and exhibits at museum and archives.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Hours: Monday-Wednesday, Friday-Sunday, 10:00 am - 5:00 pm, Thursday, 10:00 am - 8:00 pm

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Queens Park Arena
Description: Indoor ice skating rink that offers various ice sports related programs (and other sports during summer months). Location is within Queens Park itself near 3rd Avenue entrance.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Queens Park Arenex
Description: Indoor facility that includes a gymnasium and has various sports programs. Location is within Queens Park itself near 3rd Avenue entrance.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Hours: Program hours vary, refer to Active Living Guide for more details

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Queensborough Community Centre
Description: Facility includes a fitness centre, gymnasium, a library, meeting rooms and more. Various programs offered.
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming
Hours: Monday-Friday, 7:00 am - 9:30 pm, Saturday, 8:30 am - 5:30 pm, Sunday, 8:30 am - 8:30 pm

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Youth Centre
Description: Indoor facility with a gymnasium, fitness centre and various activities for youth (13-18 years old).
Category: Parks, Recreation and Community School Programming

Name: British Columbia Provincial Government - Ministry of Children and Family Development
Description: Provides child and youth mental health services.

Name: Canadian Mental Health Association (Vancouver - Fraser Branch)
Description: Offers education, housing and outreach services for mental health clients.

Name: Community Mental Health Centre - New Westminster Mental Health Office
Description: Provides a variety of mental health services.

Name: DEWY (Pacific Community Resources)
Description: DEWY assists youth aged 13 to 18 years old who have problems with alcohol and/or drug use.

Name: Douglas College Dental Assisting Clinic
Description: Provides reduced cost preventative dental services for patients between the ages of 4 and 25 years old.

Name: Family Services of Greater Vancouver - Counselling Services
Description: Provides counselling services to families, children and adults.

Name: Fraser Health Authority - New Westminster Public Health Unit
Description: Provides a variety of public health services, including vaccines.

Name: Fraser Health Authority - Royal Columbian Hospital
Description: Hospital that provides a variety of services including trauma care, birth services, emergency services etc.
Hours: Facility is open 7 days a week, 24 hours a day

Name: Fraserside Community Services - Children Who Witness Abuse
Description: Frasersideâ€™s Children Who Witness Abuse (CWWA) program provides group and individual counselling to children who have been affected by witnessing the abuse of a parent or caregiver.

Name: Inpatient Psychiatry Unit at Sherbrooke Centre (Royal Columbian Hospital)
Description: Provides services to admitted inpatients requiring further support managing mental health issues.

Name: Last Door Recovery Centre
Description: Long-term residential treatment centre for men who are experiencing problematic substance misuse.

Name: Last Door Youth Program
Description: Residential Program for male youth ages 14 to 18 who are experiencing problematic substance misuse.

Name: New West UBC Counselling Centre
Description: Provides free counselling to adults, adolescents, and families from September to June.

Name: New Westminster Homelessness Coalition Society - I's on the Street
Description: As part of I's on the Street program, helps to connect homeless or at risk of homeless people with support services such as addictions and mental health.

Name: New Westminster Public Health Unit - Prevention and Health Promotion for Substance Use
Description: The prevention and health promotion for substance use services provides support services to improve the health and functioning of children and youth with mental health disorders or potential problematic substance misuse.

Name: Perspectives Adult & Youth Addiction Services
Description: Provides free one-to-one and group counseling services to anyone affected, either directly or indirectly by the misuse of alcohol or other drugs. Self referrals accepted.
Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00 am-12:00 pm, 1:00 pm-5:00 pm

Name: Pregnancy Outreach Programs - Olivet Baptist Church
Description: Provides programs that assist pregnant women and their infants who need extra help and support. Programs may provide weekly lunches, food vouchers, prenatal vitamins, educational sessions, and one-on-one support from trained volunteer mentors. Program provided through Burnaby Family Life Institute.
Hours: Tuesday, 10:30 am - 1:00 pm for moms and babies up to 6 months, Tuesday, 12:00 pm - 2:30 pm for pregnant women

Name: Purpose Society - Youth Clinic
Description: Youth can talk with an alcohol or drug counsellor or therapist.
Hours: Tuesday, 2:30 pm - 6:00 pm, Thursday, 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm

Name: Purpose Society Community Clinic and Resource Centre for Adults
Description: Free walk-in clinic to improve the health and wellbeing of people who may otherwise be unable to receive treatment.
Hours: First and third Friday of every month, 11:00 am - 1:00 pm

Name: Sherbrooke Centre at Royal Columbian Hospital
Description: Offers psychiatric group therapy program and fraser early psychosis intervention program.
Hours: Group therapy program, hours vary. Early psychosis intervention program: Monday-Friday, 8:30am-4:30pm
Phone: psychiatric group therapy program ((604)520-4397), Fraser Early Psychosis Intervention Program ((604)777-8386); 24 hour crisis line: (604)951-8855

Name: Union Gospel Mission
Description: Provides counselling services. Has an Alcoholics Anonymous Group.
Hours: Counselling, Monday-Friday: 1:00 pm - 3:00 pm (by appointment), Alcoholics Appointment, Tuesday, 1:00 pm

Name: Westminster House Recovery Program for Women
Description: Long-term residential recovery centre for women healing from addiction.

Name: Aunt Leah's Place
Description: Offers support services to foster children, former foster children and young mothers, including housing, job training and life skills.

Name: British Columbia Provincial Government - Family Justice Centre
Description: Providers information and assistance to families that are considering or experiencing separation or divorce.
Hours: Monday, Wednesday-Friday, 8:00 am - 5:15 pm, Thursday, 8:00 am - 7:00 pm

Name: British Columbia Provincial Government - Ministry of Children and Family Development
Description: Provides child and youth mental health services, and child and family services (including child protection programs, adoption programs etc).

Name: Camaray Centre - Parent Support Program at Centennial Community Centre
Description: Offers prevention and early intervention services to parents and parents-to-be to increase a familyâ€™s knowledge and skills for effective parenting to strengthen family resiliency.

Name: Family Services of Greater Vancouver
Description: Provides a range of programs from prevention to intervention. Specific programs include: community education, counselling, employment assistance, family and parenting services, immigrant support, victim assistance and youth services.

Name: Fraserside Community Services Society
Description: Provides a range of services to individuals and families including: Children Who Witness Abuse counselling, emergency shelter for families and programs for adults with developmental and mental health issues.

Name: Immigrant Services of Society of British Columbia
Description: Provides settlement services to newcomers, including career guidance and training, confidential support, information and referral and social connections.

Name: Inclusion BC
Description: Provides a variety of support services to persons with special needs (intellectual disabilities) and their families

Name: Lower Mainland Purpose Society
Description: Delivers a continuum of programs to children, youth and families. Specific programs include child care, counselling, health, an independent secondary school, information and referral, settlement services and youth programming.

Name: New Westminster Family Place
Description: Provides a family resource program for families with children from newborn to five years old.
Hours: Drop-in: Monday - Tuesday, 9:30 am - 11:30 am, 1:00pm - 3:00 pm, Wednesday - Friday, 9:30 am - 11:30 am. Please check Family Place website for program hours

Name: Salvation Army Family Services
Description: Provides community and family services, including childcare.

Name: Simon Fraser Society for Community Living
Description: Have programs for children with special needs, including New Westminster Supported Child Development, New Westminster Aboriginal Supported Child Development, and Key Support Worker.

Name: Spirit of the Children Society
Description: Supports Aboriginal families by providing information on resources and holds various programs to bring the Aboriginal community together.

Name: Western Society for Children
Description: Provides family support and rehabilitation, parenting information, pre-employment, recreation, resources and social support for children with disabilities.

Name: Douglas College Food Bank
Description: Provides food bank services for Douglas College students.

Name: Ecole Qayqayt Elementary School - Hot Lunch Program
Description: Provides an in-house hot lunch program for Ecole Qayqayt Elementary School Students (grades K-7).

Name: Holy Trinity Anglican Cathedral - Breakfast Program
Description: Drop-in breakfast.

Name: Lord Kelvin Elementary School - Hot Lunch Program
Description: Provides an in-house hot lunch program for Lord Kelvin Elementary School Students (grades K-7).

Name: New Westminster Family Place
Description: Food bank drop-in.

Name: Port Royal Community Garden
Description: New Westminster residents can grow food in a community garden in Port Royal. Actual community garden is located in Port Royal Park (near Star Crescent); location shown is just the administrative location. There are other community gardens in New Westminster, with more information available on the New Westminster Parks and Rec Society website (http://www.newwestpcr.ca/parks/park_amenities/community_gardens.php).

Name: Pregnancy Outreach Programs - Olivet Baptist Church
Description: These programs assist pregnant women and their infants who need extra help and support. Programs may provide weekly lunches, food vouchers and prenatal vitamins. Program provided through Burnaby Family Life Institute.
Hours: Tuesday, 10:30 am - 1:00 pm for moms and babies up to 6 months, Tuesday, 12:00 pm - 2:30 pm for pregnant women

Name: Queen Elizabeth Elementary School - Hot Lunch Program
Description: Provides an in-house hot lunch program for Queen Elizabeth Elementary School Students (grades K-4).

Name: Queens Avenue United Church - Community Lunch
Description: Community lunch.

Name: Queensborough Middle School - Hot Lunch Program
Description: Provides an in-house hot lunch program for Queensborough Middle School Students (grades 5-8).

Name: Saint Barnabas Anglican Church- Community Meal and Food Cupboard Programs
Description: Community meal provides lunch and is open to all. Food cupboard program provides emergency food hampers for a couple of meals.
Hours: Community Meal: Thursday, 11:00 am, Emergency Food Cupboard: Friday, 10:00 am-12:00 pm

Name: Salvation Army - Community Lunch and Food Programs
Description: Community lunch program. Drop in food program (free bread), emergency food rations available by appointment. Also has a produce day program.
Hours: Emergency food program: Monday-Friday, 10:00 am - 12:00 pm (by appointment). Saturday Brunch: Saturday, 10:00 am. Sunday meal program: Sunday, 12:30 pm, Produce day program: Wednesday, 1:00 pm

Name: Spirit of the Children Society - Traditional Kitchen for Aboriginal Families and Youth
Description: Create a meal together in positive environment, share and learn recipes, learn how to shop for foods on a budget, learn about healthy eating habits, and experience traditional Aboriginal foods.

Name: Union Gospel Mission
Description: Breakfast and soup programs.
Hours: Breakfast Service: Monday-Friday, 8:30 am - 9:30 am, Soup Service: Monday-Friday, 11:15 am - 12:00 pm

Name: Association of Community Organizations for Reform Now (ACORN)
Description: ACORN has many social justice advocacy campaigns, including campaigns supporting affordable housing and renters.

Name: Aunt Leah's Place
Description: Provides housing subsidy program (HELPS) for former foster children. Also manages a Housing First LINK program that can connect foster youth with housing options.

Name: CMHA (Canadian Mental Health Association) - Vancouver Fraser Branch
Description: Provides a variety of housing assistance programs for persons with mental illness, including subsidy programs and case managers that assist people with finding housing.

Name: Lookout Emergency Aid Society Housing Outreach Team
Description: Assists people on the street or at high risk of eviction with their housing needs. Services include advocacy, assessment, liason and referral.

Name: MOSAIC
Description: Settlement workers can help newcomers to Canada in finding a place to live.

Name: New Westminster Homelessness Coalition Society - I's on the Street
Description: As part of I's on the Street program, helps to connect homeless or at risk of homeless people with support services such as shelter and housing.

Name: Seniors Services Society
Description: Provides housing counseling, housing outreach services, and a shelter program for homeless and at risk seniors (55+).
Hours: Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 12:30 pm, 1:00 pm - 4:30 pm

Name: Spirit of the Children Society
Description: Support for families needing supportÂ to obtain or sustain their housing. Program is based on the Seven Sacred Teachings and the Medicine Wheel.

Name: Aunt Leah's House
Description: Aunt Leahâ€™s House provides supported housing for pregnant and parenting teen moms under the age of 19 who are in the care of the Ministry. Aunt Leah's House is managed by Aunt Leah's Place. For the safety of the women and children living in these residences, the addresses of the residences are not provided; the address provided is the address for the organizational headquarters.

Name: Barnabas House
Description: Provides transitional housing for mental health clients. Managed by CMHA (Canadian Mental Health Association) - Vancouver Fraser Branch. Address refers to residence address. The administrative address for the CMHA in New Westminster is located at 435 Sixth Street.

Name: Bluebird House
Description: Provides transitional housing for mental health clients. Managed by CMHA (Canadian Mental Health Association) - Vancouver Fraser Branch. Address refers to residence address. The administrative address for the CMHA in New Westminster is located at 435 Sixth Street.

Name: Cliff Block Housing Centre
Description: Provides transitional housing units and supportive permanent housing units for persons in need. Managed by Lookout Society

Name: Columbia House
Description: Provides community living housing for persons with developmental disabilities. Managed by Posabilities Association of British Columbia. Address refers to residence address. The head office for posAbilities Association of BC is at Suite 240-4664 Lougheed Highway, Burnaby, BC.

Name: Columbia Place
Description: Provides second stage housing for women who have been involved in the criminal justice system. Supports include GED completion, career assistance and various recreational programs. Managed by Elizabeth Fry Society of Greater Vancouver.

Name: Elizabeth Barnett Terrace
Description: Supported independent living units. Managed by Pioneer Community Living Association.

Name: Elizabeth Gurney House
Description: Shelter for homeless women and their children - shelter provides daily necessities, crisis intervention, addiction and debt counseling and support in accessing low income housing. Managed by Elizabeth Fry Society of Greater Vancouver.

Name: Extreme Weather Response Shelter
Description: Provides shelter beds for homeless men and women during extreme weather (very hot, very cold, very wet, very snowy etc.).

Name: Fraserside Community Shelter
Description: Provides shelter beds for homeless families with children, as well as single adult women. Fraserside Community Shelter is operated by Fraserside Community Services Society. For the safety of the families with children, the address of the actual shelter location is not included in the listing. The address included in the listing refers to the community services office for Fraserside Community Services.

Name: Genesis House
Description: Provides supportive housing for persons with substance use issues. Managed by Westcoast Genesis Society.

Name: Ibsen Residence
Description: Provides two-year transitional housing program for adults with mental illness. Address refers to residence address. The community services office for Fraserside Community Services is the 2nd floor of 519 Seventh Street, New Westminster.

Name: Keary Street Home #1
Description: Provides community living housing for persons with developmental disabilities. Managed by Posabilities Association of British Columbia. Address refers to residence address. The head office for posAbilities Association of BC is at Suite 240-4664 Lougheed Highway, Burnaby, BC.

Name: Last Door Recovery Centre
Description: Long-term residential treatment centre for men who are experiencing problematic substance misuse. Managed by the Last Door Recovery Society.

Name: Last Door Youth Program
Description: Residential Program for male youth ages 14 to 18 who are experiencing problematic substance misuse. Managed by the Last Door Recovery Society.

Name: Lina's Place
Description: Supportive housing for persons with a mental illness. Managed by Pioneer Community Living Association. Administrative office is at 220 Sherbrooke Street.

Name: Maria Keary Cottage
Description: Provides supportive housing for persons with substance use issues. Also has low-barrier harm reduction beds for chronically homeless men. Managed by Westcoast Genesis Society.

Name: Pathways
Description: Semi-independent (second stage) apartments for women without resources or who are in transition to independent living. Managed by Elizabeth Fry Society of Greater Vancouver.

Name: Pioneer House
Description: Community residential facility for persons diagnosed with a severe and persistent mental illness. Managed by Pioneer Community Living Association.

Name: Rhoda Kaellis Residence
Description: Provides transitional housing units and supportive permanent housing units for persons in need. Managed by Lookout Society

Name: Stevenson House
Description: Provides shelter beds for homeless men. Administrative office for Salvation Army New Westminster (which operates the shelter) is located at 325 Sixth Street, New Westminster.

Name: The Russell Residence and Shelter
Description: Provides shelter beds for homeless people and supportive permanent housing units for persons in need. Managed by Lookout Society.

Name: Victoria Heights
Description: Assisted living residence for seniors.

Name: Victoria Rest Home
Description: Assisted living residence for seniors and adults with disabilities.

Name: Wells Gray Residence
Description: Provides community living housing for persons with developmental disabilities. Managed by Community Living Society. Address refers to residence address. The head office for Community Living Society is 7th Floor - 713 Columbia Street, New Westminster.

Name: Westminster House Recovery Program for Women
Description: Long-term residential recovery centre for women healing from addiction. Managed by Westminster House.

Name: Women in Need Gaining Strength (WINGS)
Description: Provides transitional and supportive housing for women and their children who are fleeing abusive situations. WINGS operates one transitional house (Monarch Place) and one supportive (second-stage) house (Chrysalis Place). For the safety of the women and chilren living in these residences, the addresses of the residences are not provided; the address provided is the mailing address for the organization.

Name: Access
Description: Provides skills and employment training programs for Aboriginal people.

Name: Aunt Leah's Place
Description: Job training opportunities are available for work in restaurants, retail stores, and landscaping.Â  Training includes work experience, help with resumes, interviewing and finding jobs for youth.

Name: Aware Society - Job Options BC
Description: Provides career planning and employment counselling.

Name: Douglas College
Description: Has the following employment programs: Skills Connect for Immigrants (assists internationally trained professionals to transition to meaningful employment using their pre-landing education, experience and skills) and Self Employment Program (offers practical training, business advice and group support to help people develop the skills and knowledge needed to start and operate a successful business).

Name: Fraser Works New Westminster Employment Service Centre
Description: Employment support and referral through a case management approach.

Name: Immigrant Services Society of BC
Description: Provides employment services for immigrants.

Name: Inclusion BC - Ready, Willing & Able
Description: Helps link persons with intellectual disabilities and Autism with job opportunities.

Name: New Westminster Homelessness Coalition Society - I's on the Street
Description: Engages homeless and at risk of homeless persons in supervised employment cleaning and tidying the sidewalks/streets in front of local businesses. Also can connect homeless or at risk of homeless persons with employment and job training.

Name: Service Canada Centre
Description: Employment, counselling and placement

Name: ACORN Canada
Description: Year round assistance with income tax preparation from volunteers.

Name: BC Provincial Government - Ministry of Child and Family Development - Aboriginal Circle 6 Tri-Cities Family Services
Description: Aboriginal Child and Youth Mental Health and Aboriginal Circle 6 Guardianship/Collaborative Practice programs.

Name: BC Provincial Government - Ministry of Child and Family Development - Aboriginal Circle 6 Tri-Cities Family Services
Description: Aboriginal 6 Tri-Cities Family Services Program.

Name: British Columbia Provincial Government - Family Justice Centre
Description: Providers information and assistance to families that are considering or experiencing separation or divorce.
Hours: Monday, Wednesday-Friday, 8:00 am - 5:15 pm, Thursday, 8:00 am - 7:00 pm

Name: British Columbia Provincial Government - Ministry of Children and Family Development
Description: Provides child and youth mental health services, and child and family services (including child protection programs, adoption programs etc).

Name: British Columbia Provincial Government - Ministry of Justice - New Westminster Community Corrections
Description: Supervises clients on bail or clients sentenced on a community court order.

Name: British Columbia Provincial Government - Ministry of Social Development and Social Innovation - Employment and Assistance Office
Description: Assists people in applying for income assistance programs.

Name: City of New Westminster - City Hall
Description: Provides municipal services including applying for building and development permits, applying for business licences, paying property taxes and electrical utility bills.

Name: City of New Westminster - Fire & Rescue Services
Description: Provides fire prevention, emergency management and education services.
Hours: Non-emergency hours: Monday to Friday, 8:30 am - 4:30 pm

Name: City of New Westminster - Police Department
Description: Provides crisis services and trauma response, crime reporting, criminal record checks, emotional support and referral service.
Hours: Non-emergency services: Monday- Sunday, 8:00 am - 7:00 pm

Name: Elizabeth Fry Society of Greater Vancouver
Description: Provides programs for woman (and their families) involved or at risk of involvement in the correctional system.

Name: Federal Government of Canada - Service Canada Centre
Description: Provides a variety of federal government services, including employment programs, social insurance number application, pension plan programs, and employment insurance application.

Name: Fraser Health Authority - Public Health Unit
Description: Provides health related programs, including STD testing, needle exchange, chronic disease prevention and child development programs.

Name: Immigrant Services Society of BC
Description: Offers free tax clinics during March and April of each year for newcomers to Canada.

Name: Mosaic
Description: Offers a free tax clinic in March and April of each year for low-income permanent residents, as well as free tax-information workshops for newcomers of all income levels.

Name: Seniors Services Society
Description: Provides free yearly income tax clinic in March and April.

Name: Union Gospel Mission
Description: Provides seasonal income tax assistance.

Name: Century House Senior Peer Counselling
Description: Trained senior volunteers provide free and confidential one-on-one support to older adults (50+) to help meet life's challenges.

Name: New Westminster Mental Health Centre
Description: Offers outreach assessment, consultation and follow-up services for seniors experiencing psychiatric problems such as dementia.

Name: New Westminster Parks, Culture and Recreation - Century House
Description: Serves as a community focal point for older adults (50+) and provides a variety of education, leisure, recreation and social programs.

Name: New Westminster Police Department Elder Abuse Unit
Description: Offers victim assistance to seniors who may be experiencing elder abuse or neglect within a relationship. Offered in partnership with Family Services of Greater Vancouver.

Name: Queen's Park Care Centre
Description: Provides residential care programs and services to seniors.

Name: Queensborough 50+ Social Club
Description: Offers opportunities for friendship, fun and social interaction. Activities and programs include bingo, a social luncheon and volunteer opportunities.

Name: Sapperton Old Age Pensioners Association
Description: Offers opportunities for friendship, fun and social interaction.

Name: Seniors Services Society
Description: Offers a range of services to seniors, including a dining and lunch program, grocery shopping, housing services and meals-on-wheels.

Name: Elizabeth Fry Society of Greater Vancouver - Maida Duncan Drop-In Centre
Description: Offers marginalized women a place to go for hot lunches, showers, laundry, free clothing and household items, as well social activities and education upgrading.

Name: Union Gospel Mission
Description: Breakfast and soup programs.
Hours: Breakfast Service: Monday-Friday, 8:30 am - 9:30 am, Soup Service: Monday-Friday, 11:15 am - 12:00 pm

Name: Bridgeview Heights
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH BC HOUSING either on-line or by mail. Housing for families with children.

Name: Cedar Manor
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH CEDAR MANOR - only market rent units available currently.Housing for seniors (55+), persons with disabilities and singles.

Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH CONNAUGHT HEIGHTS PENTECOSTAL SOCIETY by mail. Housing for seniors (55+).

Name: Crown Manor
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH BC HOUSING either on-line or by mail. Housing for seniors (55+), persons with disabilities, singles, and families with children.

Name: Dunwood Place
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH THE PRESBYTERIAN SENIOR CITIZENS' HOUSING SOCIETY in person or by mail. Housing for seniors (65+).

Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH BC HOUSING either on-line or by mail. Housing for families with children.

Name: Hunter Heights
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH FRASERSIDE COMMUNITY SERVICES. Housing for singles and couples.

Name: Legion Manor
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH ROYAL CITY LEGION HOUSING SOCIETY by mail. Housing for seniors (55+).

Name: Lions Moody Park Tower
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH BC HOUSING either on-line or by mail. Housing for seniors (55+) and persons with disabilities.

Name: London Square
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH BC HOUSING either on-line or by mail. Housing for families with children.

Name: McBride Place
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH BC HOUSING either on-line or by mail. Housing for families with children.

Name: New Westminster Housing Co-operative
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH NEW WESTMINSTER HOUSING CO-OPERATIVE MEMBERSHIP COMMITTEE by mail or by email. Co-op housing for all household types.

Name: Queen's Avenue Hsg Co-op
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH QUEEN'S AVENUE HOUSING COOPERATIVE by mail or by email. Co-op housing for all household types.

Description: MUST APPLY THROUGHÂ  QUEEN'S PARK HOUSING CO-OP MEMBERSHIP COMMITTEE by mail. Co-op housing for all household types.

Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH RIVERBEND HOUSING CO-OP MEMBERSHIP COMMITTEE by mail or email. Co-op housing for all household types.

Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH BC HOUSING by mail or online. Housing for seniors (55+) and persons with disabilities.

Name: Rotary Tower

Name: Sapperton Terrace Hsg Co-op
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH SAPPERTON TERRACE HOUSING CO-OP MEMBERSHIP COMMITTEE by mail. Co-op housing for all household types.

Name: Wesley Manor
Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH WESLEY MANOR SOCIETY - phone Wesley Manor Society for more details. Housing for seniors (55+ years old).

Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH WESTMINSTER HEIGHTS CO-OP MEMBERSHIP COMMITTEE by mail. Co-op housing for families with children.

Description: MUST APPLY THROUGH WESTMINSTER LANDING CO-OP MEMBERSHIP COMMITTEE by mail. Co-op housing for all household types

Name: Family Services of Greater Vancouver
Description: Provides various programs related to literacy and education (including financial literacy courses, ESL practice groups) etc. . Locations for courses and programs vary - please visit website for more details.

Name: I-Care Literacy Program (Douglas College)
Description: Adults can meet with a trained volunteer tutor once a week to learn basic reading, writing and spelling.

Name: Immigrant Services Society of BC
Description: Provides language learning services through LINC  (Language Instruction for Newcomers to Canada) program.

Name: Inclusion BC - On My Way Program
Description: A project to help students with special needs and their families prepare for life after high school.

Name: New Westminster Public Library - Main Branch
Description: Offers electronic and written resources (books, videos etc), learning related events and programs for children, teens and adults. Also has ESL conversation circles.
Hours: Monday-Thursday, 9:30 am - 9 pm, Friday & Saturday, 9:30 am - 6 pm, Sunday, 12 pm- 5 pm

Name: New Westminster Public Library - Queensborough Branch
Description: Offers electronic and written resources (books, videos etc), learning related events and programs for children, teens and adults. Also has ESL conversation circles.
Hours: Monday & Saturday, 10 am - 2 pm, Tuesday & Thursday, 12 pm - 8 pm, Wednesday and Friday, 10 am - 6 pm

Name: New Westminster School District - Adult Learning Centre (Downtown)
Description: Provides community education courses, including high school upgrade courses. Language learning centre provides English language learning courses.

Name: New Westminster School District - Adult Learning Centre and Language Learning Centre (Pearson)
Description: Provides community education courses, including high school upgrade courses. Language learning centre provides English language learning courses.

Name: New Westminster School District - General (School Board office)
Description: Provides public education for elementary, middle, and secondary school students at various schools throughout New Westminster.

Name: New Westminster School District - Power Program
Description: High school completion program for ages 16-18 years old.

Name: New Westminster School District - SIGMA Youth Adult Learning Centre
Description: Offers flexible high school completion program for students ages 16-18 years old.

Name: New Westminster School District - Urban First Nations Learning Support Centre
Description: Offers courses and services (including grade 12 diploma - Adult Dogwood) for Aboriginal People.
Hours: Monday to Thursday, 11:30 am - 2:30 pm (September to June)

Name: Purpose Society - English Made Easy Program
Description: Provides an opportunity for parents, grandparents and children (up to six years of age) to learn English, make friends, enjoy great food and learn about other cultures.

Name: Purpose Society - Purpose Secondary School
Description: High school graduation program for grades 9 to 12.

Name: UFCW - 247 Training and Education Centre
Description: Offers various career related and skills courses.

Name: Union Gospel Mission
Description: Provides monthly lifeskills programming and workshops.
